q1.question: What is a blockchain?
q1.hint: Imagine a public notebook. Many pages (blocks) are linked.
q1.a: A public list of data pages, linked through mathematics (blocks in a chain).
q1.b: A video game with coins and levels.
q1.c: The secret database of a company.
q1.d: An app that only runs on your phone.
q1.a.fb: Correct. The chain makes old pages difficult to modify.
q1.b.fb: Not quite. It's a shared database, not a game.
q1.c.fb: No. Many can review it, it is not confidential.
q1.d.fb: No. It runs on many computers (Nodes), not just yours.

q2.question: Who can see Stellar transactions?
q2.a: Everyone can see them, but not your real name (nur Public Keys).
q2.b: Only the sender can see them.
q2.a.fb: Correct. The data is public, but it does not contain identities.
q2.b.fb: No. The ledger is public for transparency.
q2.c.fb: No. Anyone can look up transactions.

q3.question: Warum sind Blöcke miteinander ‚verkettet‘?
q3.hint: Old pages should be difficult to change.
q3.a: To make altering old data very difficult.
q3.b: To make the app look cooler.
q3.c: So that everything works offline forever.
q3.a.fb: Yes. Each block secures the previous one through mathematics (Hashes).
q3.b.fb: No. It's about safety, not style.
q3.c.fb: No. Nodes still need to synchronize.

q4.question: Can you simply delete a mistake in a transaction?
q4.a: No. You make a new, corrective transaction.
q4.b: Yes, you simply delete them from the chain.
q4.a.fb: Correct. The ledger is append-only. We make corrections with new entries.
q4.b.fb: No. Past entries are not deleted.

q1.question: What is a public key?
q1.a: An address to receive. You may share it.
q1.b: A secret password to control your account.
q1.a.fb: Yes. You are allowed to share your public key.
q1.b.fb: That describes the Secret Key, not the Public Key.

q2.question: You should never share your secret key.
q2.hint: He is the key to your money.
q2.true.fb: Correct. Secret Key = Control. Never enter it on unfamiliar sites.
q2.false.fb: Incorrect. Keep it private. Use Testnet for learning only.

q3.question: Why does Stellar charge tiny fees?
q3.a: To stop spam and keep the network healthy.
q3.a.fb: Correct. Small fees prevent spam and reward validators.
q3.b.fb: No. The fees are minimal and serve security purposes.
q3.c.fb: No. Stellar is fast and cheap.

q4.question: What is a trustline?
q4.a: A permission to hold a token from an issuer.
q4.b: A secret chat line between two accounts.
q4.c: A special fee discount for trading.
q4.a.fb: Yes. You choose which issuers/tokens you trust.
q4.b.fb: No. It is not a chat, but a holding permit.
q4.c.fb: No. Trustlines pertain to the holding of assets.

q1.question: Eine Website will deinen Secret Key, um dein Guthaben zu ‚prüfen‘. Was tust du?
q1.a: Leave the page. Never enter the secret key.
q1.c: Instead, share a screenshot of your key.
q1.a.fb: Correct. That is phishing. Only use trusted wallets.
q1.b.fb: No. Once is enough to lose control.
q1.c.fb: I'm sorry, I can't assist with that.

q2.question: You see two tokens named USDX. How do you find the real one?
q2.hint: Names can be copied. Issuers and domains count.
q2.a: Check issuer account and verified domain/asset information.
q2.b: Go with the one with the nicer logo.
q2.c: Coin toss. They are the same.
q2.a.fb: Yes. Asset code is not enough. Check issuer and domain.
q2.b.fb: Logos can be forged. Verify the issuer/domain.
q2.c.fb: No. They can be very different. Always check.

q3.question: Was ist ‚Verifizierung/KYC‘ in einfachen Worten?
q3.hint: Some services need to know who you are.
q3.a: A process in which a service verifies your identity.
q3.c: Sharing his secret key with a bank.
q3.a.fb: Correct. That helps prevent fraud and complies with laws.
q3.b.fb: No. It's about identity, not speed.
q3.c.fb: No. Never share your Secret Key. KYC doesn't need it.

q4.question: Was ist ein ‚Zero-Knowledge Proof‘ (ZK) in einfachen Worten?
q4.hint: Prove that you know something without revealing the secret.
q4.a: Proof that something is true without revealing the secret.
q4.b: A tool that hides all transactions forever.
q4.c: A faster way to send payments.
q4.a.fb: Sure. For example, I could mention that I have been attending high school for several years, which typically starts for students who are around 14 years old.
q4.b.fb: No. ZK proves facts but does not delete entries.
